  • Constructor Details

    • Character

      public Character(String name, LevelMap map, int mapX, int mapY, int life, int speed, GameCharacter gameCharacter)
      Character Constructor.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the character
      map - The map
      mapX - The X-axis position of the character
      mapY - The Y-axis position of the character
      life - The initial life points of the character
      speed - The initial speed of the character
      gameCharacter - The game character type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - in case an argument is not wrong

      Sets the character's map to a new one.
      Parameters:
      newMap - The new LevelMap to set for the character

    • addOneLife

      public void addOneLife()
      Increases the character's life by one.

    • removeOneLife

      public void removeOneLife()
      Decreases the character's life by one. If the life count reaches zero. The character is marked as not alive (dead).

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets a character to its initial state (lives, position, etc...). Does not reset the score because it should keep it between rounds.

    • isAlive

      public boolean isAlive()
      Character current state of life.
      Returns:
      boolean Player state of life

    • setStandingStill

      public void setStandingStill()
      Caracter is standing still.

      Move character to the left.

      Move character Up.

    • checkMove

      public boolean checkMove(int futureX, int futureY)
      Check if the move is possible or not.
      Parameters:
      futureX - x-position value
      futureY - y-position value
      Returns:
      boolean

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Character other)
      Compares this character to another character based on their score.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Character>
      Parameters:
      other - the character to compare to
      Returns:
      a negative integer if this character has a higher score than the other; zero if their scores are equal; a positive integer if this character has a lower score than the other

    • playDeadSound

      public void playDeadSound()
      Play death sound. It is a distinct method so that it can be removed in tests later.
